data.title: Volunteer Front Desk Assistant (Family Service Centre)
data.description:
With 7 centres across the island,  THK Family Service Centres promote and improve the social well-being of every individual in the family, at every stage of life. Receive satisfaction through helping others!

Provides assistance and information to walk-in at the Family Service Centres.

Responsibilities:
•	Understand walk-in clients’ needs, provide basic information and channel the inquiries to the relevant staff for action and follow-up. 
•	Assist and provide general day to day administrative support such as data entry work. 
•	Maintain the general upkeep of the center in terms of cleanliness. 

Requirements:
•	Ability to speak in Mother Tongue and/or one dialect.
•	Ability to read and speak in English is preferred.
•	Maintain confidentiality of all clients’ information.
•	Required to clear background screening

Time Commitment:
•	Selection of date and time as per volunteer’s availability
•	Minimum 4 hours per session

Location:
We would match you to the nearest centre;
•	THK Family Service Centre @ MacPherson
Blk 91 Paya Lebar Way #01-3023, Singapore 370091
•	THK FSC @ Bedok North
Blk 554 Bedok North St 3 #01-241, Singapore 460554
•	THK Family Service Centre @ Bukit Panjang
Blk 139 Petir Road #01-448, Singapore 670139
•	THK FSC @ Tanjong Pagar
Blk 18 Jalan Membina #04-01, Singapore 164018
•	THK FSC @ Jurong
Blk 183B Boon Lay Ave, #01-716, Singapore 642183
•	THK Centre for Family Harmony (CFH) @ Circuit
Blk 37 Circuit Road #02-455, Singapore 370037
•	THK Centre for Family Harmony (CFH) @ Commonwealth
54 Commonwealth Drive #01-566 Singapore 142054
data.one_line_description: Safeguarding the Vulnerables with us!

organizer.name: Thye Hua Kwan Moral Charities
organizer.description:
ABOUT THK

Thye Hua Kwan Moral Charities (THKMC) is the charity arm of Thye Hua Kwan Moral Society (THKMS) and was incorporated in October 2011 as a charity with an IPC status to provide multiple social and welfare services to the community at large. THKMC provides assistance to the various groups in our community through more than 70 programmes, services, welfare homes and centres. These services are catered to namely the Elderly, Families, Children & Youths and Persons with Disabilities.


WHY VOLUNTEER WITH THK?

Always visiting the same old places, or doing the same things during your free time? Not sure how you can better invest your time while making a difference. 

We are here to change your perspective as there’s always a fresh way of looking at something. “Sometimes a break from your routine is the very thing you need!” 
Be a THK Aviator and allocate your time to worthy causes. From caring for youths at risk and the elderly to lending a hand at outreach activities and events, we have endless volunteering opportunities where you will feel good by doing good. 

1.	Discover yourself – you will be happier and healthier
Life can be full of challenges but with every new volunteering opportunity, it gives you a new perspective. Donating time to others is good for your mind and body as you get to interact with people and be their voice. The more you volunteer, the more experiences you gain, thus having a special sense of belonging and achievement. 

2.	You have time for more
When you give your time to others, in turn you will have more time on hand. You connect with others, and when focusing on other people, it makes you feel less time constrained.
 
3.	Learn and gain new skills 
Volunteering is like an adventure, oftentimes you might find yourself in for a fun surprise. Giving your time opens opportunities for you to develop and practise new skills such as communication, social and leadership skills. Inspire others to give back and journey as one to help transform lives.
organizer.address: 1 North Bridge Road #03-33 High Street Centre Singapore 179094

data.title: Volunteer Engagement Associate  (Family Service Centre)
data.description:
Support and aid individuals and families that unable to perform tasks independently for a variety of reasons (physical, cognitive, emotional, and social).

Responsibilities:
Each case is unique and needs different kinds of support, below are some examples of what volunteers might support with:
•	Chaperone a person with a disability for a medical appointment.
•	Receive an elderly who has been discharged from the hospital
•	Accompany a senior to a government agency to clear paperwork
•	Fetch a child back home from a residential home.

Note: Volunteers to decide they wish to have one client or more at any one time.

Requirements:
•	Proficient in English and Mother Tongue. Preferably, also local dialects.
•	Genuine interest in working with underprivileged individuals in the 
Community. 
•	Openness, empathy and sensitivity engaging with people from all backgrounds.
•	Approachable, non-judgmental and caring.
•	Willing to be trained & committed to training.

Time Commitment:
•	Minimum of six months commitment to volunteering. 
•	This position is not tied to a specific day or time and attend to the client according to the needs. 

Location:
•	THK Family Service Centre @ MacPherson
Blk 91 Paya Lebar Way #01-3023, Singapore 370091
•	THK FSC @ Bedok North
Blk 554 Bedok North St 3 #01-241, Singapore 460554
•	THK Family Service Centre @ Bukit Panjang
Blk 139 Petir Road #01-448, Singapore 670139
•	THK FSC @ Tanjong Pagar
Blk 18 Jalan Membina #04-01, Singapore 164018
•	THK FSC @ Jurong
Blk 183B Boon Lay Ave, #01-716, Singapore 642183
•	THK Centre for Family Harmony (CFH) @ Circuit
Blk 37 Circuit Road #02-455, Singapore 370037
•	THK Centre for Family Harmony (CFH) @ Commonwealth
54 Commonwealth Drive #01-566, Singapore 142054

data.title: Volunteer Community Facilitator (Family Service Centre)
data.description:
Assume as a mentor role to develop and foster knowledge and skills in a small group and individual level.

Responsibilities:
•	Work closely with Centre staff to prepare and deliver the program and activity.
•	Respectfully and enthusiastically engage clients in the Community Group Work and Focus Group Discussion.
•	Facilitate discussions and administer client satisfaction surveys. 
•	Opportunities to lead/co-lead workshops or activities, depending on the needs of the clients.

Requirements:
•	Proficient in English (Mother Tongue language is a plus)
•	Demonstrated knowledge of the topic (for a leading role) 
•	Openness, empathy, and sensitivity engaging with people from all backgrounds
•	Willing to be trained & committed to training
•	Ability to work as part of a team

Time Commitment:
•	Minimum of six months commitment to volunteering
•	Whenever there is Community Group Work and Focus Group discussion organized.  

Location:
•	THK Family Service Centre @ MacPherson
Blk 91 Paya Lebar Way #01-3023, Singapore 370091
•	THK FSC @ Bedok North
Blk 554 Bedok North St 3 #01-241, Singapore 460554
•	THK Family Service Centre @ Bukit Panjang
Blk 139 Petir Road #01-448, Singapore 670139
•	THK FSC @ Tanjong Pagar
Blk 18 Jalan Membina #04-01, Singapore 164018
•	THK FSC @ Jurong
Blk 183B Boon Lay Ave, #01-716, Singapore 642183
•	THK Centre for Family Harmony (CFH) @ Circuit
Blk 37 Circuit Road #02-455, Singapore 370037
•	THK Centre for Family Harmony (CFH) @ Commonwealth
54 Commonwealth Drive #01-566, Singapore 142054

data.title: Operations Assistant (Senior Activity Centre)
data.description:
Join the group of dedicated volunteers at the Senior Activity Centers (SACs).  Whether you volunteer on a regular basis or only for special occasions, the Center needs you to help keep the Center's programs successful and running smoothly. 

Responsibilities:
•	Perform basic housekeeping of the Centre.
•	Support the Centre Staff in the smooth running of the center. during lunchtime or when staff is out for assignments.
•	Provide simple admin support. 
•	Render assistance to seniors

Requirements:
•     Able to converse in Malay, Tamil, Mandarin, or any dialect.
•	Possess passion and empathy in helping the elderly.
•	Has patience in connecting with others and form positive. relationships.

Time Commitment:
•	Selection of day and time as per volunteer’s availability
•     Up to 4 hours per session

Location:
We would match you to the nearest THK Active Ageing Centre:
•	Bedok South / Central 
•	Toa Payoh Lor 6, 7, 8 / Central 
•	Ang Mo Kio Ave 5, 6, 8 ,9 / Central 
•	Beo Crescent 
•	Boon Lay Place/Boon Lay Drive 
•	Taman Jurong/ Tah Ching Rd/ Yuan Ching Rd/ Kang Ching Rd
data.one_line_description: Join us and make a difference in a senior’s life!

data.title: Medical Escorts (Home for Disabled)
data.description:
Responsibilities:
•	Accompany and provide support to the residents before/ during/ between transportation.
•	Attend to resident’s needs and provide physical assistance, if needed
•	Settling of payment (if required), scheduling of future appointments, and collecting of medicine at the pharmacy
•	Provide accurate and timely updates to the Nursing team

Requirements:
•	Ability to speak in Mother Tongue and/or one dialect.
•	Ability to read and speak in English is preferred.
•	No major health problems
•	Passion for working with people with special needs

Time Commitment:
•	No minimum hours required (a typical trip takes up to 2-4 hours) 
•	Actual assignments depend on the number of medical appointments

Location:
We would match you to the nearest centre;
1.	THK Home for Disabled @ Sembawang
        7 Sembawang Walk, Singapore 756977
2.	THK Home for Disabled @ Eunos
        20 Jalan Eunos, Singapore 419494
3.	THK Home for Disabled Adults @ Chai Chee
        2 Chai Chee Lane, Singapore 469030
data.one_line_description: Be part of team to keep our residents healthy!

data.title: Volunteer Operations Assistant (Home for Disabled)
data.description:
With 5 centres across the island, THK Home for Disabled provides residential care to people in needs. Your participation can further strengthen the well-being of our residents!

Responsibilities:
•	Prepare residents for their various activities, meals and self-care.
•	To supervise residents during activities to ensure they are safe and meaningfully engaged
•	To assist the Operations team in managing external contractors and vendors 
•	To assist the Operations team with basic administrative duties (i.e. date entry & filing of documents)

Requirements:
•	Able to converse in English or Mother Tongue or Dialect
•	Passion for working with people with special needs

Time Commitment:
•	Selection of date and time as per volunteer’s availability
•     Up to 4 hours per session

Location:
We would match you to the nearest centre;
•	THK Home for Disabled @ Sembawang
         7 Sembawang Walk, Singapore 756977
•	THK Home for Disabled @ Eunos
         20 Jalan Eunos, Singapore 419494
•	THK Home for Disabled Adults @ Chai Chee
         2 Chai Chee Lane, Singapore 469030
•	THK Pan-Disability Centre @ Eunos
         Blk 3 Eunos Crescent #01-2577, Singapore 400003
•	THK Day Activity Centre @ Chai Chee
         2 Chai Chee Lane, Singapore 469030

data.title: Volunteer Activity Coordinator (Home for Disabled)
data.description:
Make someone’s day by imparting knowledge to the residents! 

Responsibilities:
Engage residents through activities such as Singing, art & craft, pottery, crochet, baking, sports, and teaching English or simply providing a listening ear can be therapeutic to the residents.

Requirements:
•	Ability to create and conduct activities in English or Mother Tongue or dialect
•	Passion in befriending and engaging with others in one-on-one and group setting

Time Commitment:
•	Selection of date and time as per volunteer’s availability
•     Up to 2 hours per session 
•	Weekends commitment is greatly appreciated

Location:
We would match you to the nearest centre;
•	THK Home for Disabled @ Sembawang
         7 Sembawang Walk, Singapore 756977
•	THK Home for Disabled @ Eunos
         20 Jalan Eunos, Singapore 419494
•	THK Home for Disabled Adults @ Chai Chee
         2 Chai Chee Lane, Singapore 469030
•	THK Pan-Disability Centre @ Eunos
         Blk 3 Eunos Crescent #01-2577, Singapore 400003
•	THK Day Activity Centre @ Chai Chee
         2 Chai Chee Lane, Singapore 469030

data.title: (Online Sharing) Volunteers' Introduction to PDPA
data.description:
VC@BL will be providing PDPA training for volunteers to familiarise themselves during their volunteer training.

i. To engage with the volunteers from VC @ Boon Lay by introducing training opportunities
ii. To foster new collaborative opportunities that allow for sustainable partnerships
iii. To empower and develop volunteers to plan for events and activities

This PDPA training aims to equip volunteers with knowledge on how to safeguard their personal data from misuse and to maintain individuals' trust in organisations as volunteers. If you have any questions, feel free to contact us through Whatsapp at  9762 8685 (Tisa) or email Nursriwati.Yusri@thkmc.org.sg .
data.one_line_description: “Am I allowed to post this?” If you’ve ever asked yourself if you can should post a photo while volunteering, then this is the right workshop for you.

data.title: Volunteer Teacher Aide for Children with Developmental Needs ( 4 centres Islandwide )
data.description:
Are you passionate about children? Or would love to teach children with developmental needs? Being a Volunteer Teacher Aide could be your calling! Sign up now and assist our teachers in enriching their lives today.

Responsibilities:
•	Record attendance and temperature. Attend to students who are unwell.
•	Assist teachers in classroom and behavior management.
•	Supervising students during feeding, toileting, before/after school etc.
•	Maintaining a safe, tidy, neat, and conducive learning environment.

Requirements:
•	Above 18 years of age (parental consent required for those under the age of 18).
•	Up to 4 hours per round 
•	9am to 6pm on Monday to Fridays (excluding Public Holidays). 
•	May be activated on an ad-hoc basis if the need arises.
•	Able to cope with physical demands.
•	No major health problems.
•	Positive work attitude.
•	Passion for working with children with special needs.
•	Possess good communication skills.
•	Has patience in handling special needs students.
•	May have to clear medical check and background screening.

What you can expect:
- Onboarding and induction sessions, and on-the-job training to equip individuals with relevant knowledge and skills will be provided
- Attractive benefits for all THKMC volunteers

**Your schedule will be discussed after signup.
data.one_line_description: Join us as a Volunteer Teacher Aide for Children with Developmental Needs today!

data.title: Volunteers for Outreach
data.description:
We will be reaching out to the residents of Geylang Region through door-knocking, to understand the needs of the residents and to increase visibility of our services.

It will be on alternate Tuesday (1st and 3rd Tuesday) every month, 10am to 12pm

Volunteers will be required to:
- walk and stand for at least 2 hours
- conduct simple survey with Geylang residents
*Training will be provided upon signup
data.one_line_description: We will be reaching out to the residents of Geylang Region through door-knocking, to understand the needs of the residents and to increase visibility of our services.

organizer.name: Thye Hua Kwan Moral Charities
organizer.description:
ABOUT THK

Thye Hua Kwan Moral Charities (THKMC) is the charity arm of Thye Hua Kwan Moral Society (THKMS) and was incorporated in October 2011 as a charity with an IPC status to provide multiple social and welfare services to the community at large. THKMC provides assistance to the various groups in our community through more than 70 programmes, services, welfare homes and centres. These services are catered to namely the Elderly, Families, Children & Youths and Persons with Disabilities.


WHY VOLUNTEER WITH THK?

Always visiting the same old places, or doing the same things during your free time? Not sure how you can better invest your time while making a difference. 

We are here to change your perspective as there’s always a fresh way of looking at something. “Sometimes a break from your routine is the very thing you need!” 
Be a THK Aviator and allocate your time to worthy causes. From caring for youths at risk and the elderly to lending a hand at outreach activities and events, we have endless volunteering opportunities where you will feel good by doing good. 

1.	Discover yourself – you will be happier and healthier
Life can be full of challenges but with every new volunteering opportunity, it gives you a new perspective. Donating time to others is good for your mind and body as you get to interact with people and be their voice. The more you volunteer, the more experiences you gain, thus having a special sense of belonging and achievement. 

2.	You have time for more
When you give your time to others, in turn you will have more time on hand. You connect with others, and when focusing on other people, it makes you feel less time constrained.
 
3.	Learn and gain new skills 
Volunteering is like an adventure, oftentimes you might find yourself in for a fun surprise. Giving your time opens opportunities for you to develop and practise new skills such as communication, social and leadership skills. Inspire others to give back and journey as one to help transform lives.
organizer.address: 1 North Bridge Road #03-33 High Street Centre Singapore 179094

data.title: Volunteer with PSALT Care (Online and/or in-person)
data.description:
Volunteers will assist to facilitate some of our existing virtual or in-person monthly activities.  

Volunteers may also initiate new programmes or activities that support mental health recovery, which may be included as part of our regular programmes in the future.  

Regular commitment (weekly/bi-weekly) is preferred to better establish rapport with our members.
data.one_line_description: Looking for regular volunteers

organizer.name: PSALT Care Ltd
organizer.description: Psalt Care Ltd (pronounced as ‘Salt-care’), is a charity organization set up to support and sustain persons with diagnosed mental health and addiction challenges, whom we refer to as ‘clients’, in their recovery journey.  It is a fundamental belief in Psaltcare that recovery is possible. Recovery involves supporting clients, as they continue with the medication prescribed by their doctors, through modalities such as psychotherapy, mental health education, and group support sessions. Psaltcare endeavors to support its clients by means of organizing peer-led support group meetings which are facilitated by formally trained, volunteer Peer Support Specialists.  These small group sessions, each comprising between 12-16 clients, meet regularly to briefly discuss a mental health topic and encourage one another in their recovery journey.  Speaking with empathy from their own lived experiences, the peers and their facilitator share a common bond and sphere of encouragement that non-peers may not fully appreciate. Psaltcare is recognized by the National Council of Social Services(“NCSS”)  as a full member since 1 April 2014.  It is also affiliated to the US-based Depression and Bipolar Support Alliance (“DBSA”) and operates as its recognized Singapore chapter.  A large pool of active volunteers does most of the work, supported by a small team of administrative staff.
organizer.address: 38 Jln Lepas, Singapore 537962

tags.name: mental, health, condition, gardening, nature, walk, hike, art, support, group, zoom, online, virtual, games, eat, outings

data.title: Medical Escort needed (Weekdays)
data.description: We are looking for a volunteer to help to bring one of our elderly clients to the hospital for medical appointment. The medical appointment would be on weekdays and transport cost will be borne by our staff. Client may be on wheelchair bound as well hence, we will be providing training for the interested volunteers.
data.one_line_description: Medical Escort for Seniors

data.title: Escorts for Seniors @ AMK
data.description:
Enjoy spending time with the elderly? Talk up a storm and get to know our senior clients! We need your assistance to escort them for their weekly activities:
- Banking
- Taking a walk
- Grocery shopping
- Getting a drink at nearby coffeeshop

Requirements:
- Volunteers may carry out duties weekly or every alternate week
- Tentative day and time: Thursdays, 10.30am; Volunteers may discuss timings after signing up
data.one_line_description: Befriend and help escort the elderly for their weekly activity!

data.title: Tuition Teachers for Seniors
data.description:
To teach basic English and/ or Malay to our seniors residing in the Eunos region.

Commitment: Once a week
Venue: Onsite @ clients' homes
Duration: 45mins

Timeslots:
2:30pm - 3:15pm OR
4pm - 4:45pm

data.title: Coordinator for Interest group
data.description:
Interest group coordinator

Collect information on interest groups needs
Arrange for training when needed
Manage schedules for Interest group activities
Communicate frequently with beneficiaries and volunteers
Keep and manage records of Interest groups’ information and work 

Flexible working hours and work from home, at least 3 months
data.one_line_description: HIGH STREET CENTRE

data.title: Caring Assistance from Neighbours (CAN) Carers @ Ang Mo Kio
data.description:
Volunteers will assist in the following:
- Conduct regular home visits to monitor vulnerable seniors
- Feedback on any changes regarding the seniors
- Establish and maintain relationships
- Provide emotional and social support

Volunteer Requirements:
- Open to all
- Able to commit 4 times a month, fortnightly on weekday or weekend (your timeslots will be confirmed after sign-up)
- Minimum Age: 21
data.one_line_description: CAN Carers provide social support through monitoring vulnerable elderly with complex needs to enable them to age in place within the community for as long as possible.

data.title: Volunteers Wanted! Assist in Pre-Vocational Classes @ Eunos
data.description:
Our Pan-Disability Centre requires YOUR help! Join us and assist in facilitating and delivering pre-vocational lessons to our clients.

Details:
- Mondays to Fridays
- Lesson timeslots: 1pm-2pm, 2pm-3pm
- Lessons are conducted using CANVAS LMS & Nearpod, training will be provided
- iPads are used for the lessons, other learning activities may be included

Volunteer Requirements:
- Able to commit for at least 3 months
- Able to commit daily
- Please note that once confirmed for this activity, you cannot volunteer at other centres due to safety measures and precautions

**You will be informed if any details such as location or timing of activity are subjected to change.

Got questions? WhatsApp or call us @ 8721 8599
data.one_line_description: Help our clients with their pre-vocational classes!

data.title: Volunteers Wanted! Baking Assistants for THK Home for Disabled Adults @ Chai Chee
data.description:
Baking is not only a fun activity to do, but can become an important skillset for our clients with disabilities as a possible future source of income! Come on down to the THK Home for Disabled @ Chai Chee and join us for a meaningful baking session!

Details:
- Weekends
- Timeslots: 9.30am to 11am, 12pm to 3.30pm

Volunteer Requirements:
- Able to commit for at least 3 months
- Please note that once confirmed for this activity, you cannot volunteer at other centres due to safety measures and precautions

**You will be informed if any details such as location or timing of activity are subjected to change.

Got questions? WhatsApp or call us @ 8721 8599
data.one_line_description: Assist our clients in their baking sessions with their trainer!

data.title: CAN Carers wanted! (Bedok)
data.description:
Caring Assistance From Neighbours provides social and healthcare support to the elderly, which empowers neighbours within a community to be given the role of a carer.

Responsibilities of a CAN Carer:
* Conduct regular home visits to monitor vulnerable seniors
* Feedback on any changes regarding the seniors
* Establish and maintain relationships
* Provide emotional and social support

Volunteer Requirements:
*Minimum age of 21
*Able to commit 4 times a month, weekday or weekend (your timeslots will be confirmed after sign-up)
*Ability to communicate in Mother Tongue and/or Mandarin dialect is preferred
*Training on managing the elderly will be provided
data.one_line_description: Caring Assistance From Neighbours (CAN) Service @ Bedok

data.title: Volunteering at the Parada School in Uttaradit/Thailand
data.description: Teaching basic spoken English or Chinese to our kindergarten kids. You would only teach in the morning and in the afternoon you are able to explore the beauty of Uttaradit City.
data.one_line_description: Teaching our Kindergarten kids basic spoken English or Chinese

organizer.name: Paradanusorn School Uttaradit/Thailand
organizer.description: We are a general education school in Uttaradit/Thailand and have approx. 500 pupils. The kids are between 3 and 15 years old. We teach mainly kids from low or poor income families and therefore need your help, in volunteering at our school.
organizer.address: Paradanusorn School

location.text: 112 Injaime Road, ตำบล ท่าเสา Uttaradit, 53000, Thailand

skills.name: being able to speak basic English or Chinese

data.title: AMKFSC Vounteers
data.description:
Founded in 1978, AMKFSC Community Services Ltd. ("AMKFSC") is a community-based social service agency, which provides a holistic range of services to support children, youths, families and seniors at multiple touchpoints across Singapore.

AMKFSC operates four family service centres across Ang Mo Kio, Sengkang and Punggol. We also provide other support services such as student care, senior services, a youth centre, mental health support programmes and a transitional shelter.

*As the volunteer role is generic, we will reach out to you on the available roles. If you did not receive any email of confirmation, kindly email or call us!
data.one_line_description: General volunteering supporting all functions of a charity to better the services for the beneficiaries

organizer.name: AMKFSC Community Services
organizer.description:
Founded in 1978, AMKFSC Community Services Ltd. ("AMKFSC") is a leading community-based social service agency, which provides a holistic range of services to support children, youths, families and seniors at multiple touchpoints across Singapore.

AMKFSC operates four family service centres across Ang Mo Kio, Sengkang and Punggol. We also provide other support services such as student care, senior services, a youth centre, a transitional shelter and mental health support programmes.
organizer.address: 133 New Bridge Road, Chinatown Point #04-09 Singapore 059413
